Victoria Memorial The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building, which is considered to be the pride of Kolkata. Built between 1906 and 1921, it is dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria. Now, it is a museum and a popular tourist spot under the Ministry of Culture. Victoria Memorial Hall, 1, Queens Way, Maidan, Kolkata, West Bengal 700071 10:00–18:00. Tuesdays closed. ₹20~₹200 Fort William Palace Fort William is a fort built in Kolkata on the eastern banks of the River Hooghly, the major distributary of Ganges, during the early years of the Bengal Presidency in the British India. Maidan, Fort William, Hastings, Kolkata, West Bengal 700021 Mon-Sun : 10:00 A.M – 5:30 P.M Free Howrah Bridge Titled as the ‘oldest but the busiest’ place in Kolkata, the Howrah Bridge was built over the Hooghly river to ensure connectivity between the two major cities of Kolkata and Howrah. Howrah, West Bengal 700001 Always open Science City Take some time to visit the architectural wonder of the Science City, which is the largest science centre throughout India. Housing a Space Odyssey, Dynamotion, Evolution Park Theme Tour, Maritime Centre, and Earth Exploration Hall, it is one of the best Kolkata tourist places in terms of technology, and architecture. East Topsia, Topsia, Kolkata, West Bengal 700105 Mon-Sun : 09:00 AM - 08:00 PM ₹200 033 2285 4343 Belur Math Belur Math is an important pilgrimage site and the headquarters of Ramakrishna Math and Mission. It is one of the best Kolkata tourist places for people who wish to seek inner peace. Belur, Howrah, West Bengal 711202 033 2654 1144 Mon-Sun : 08:30 AM - 06:00 PM Indian Museum The Indian Museum in Kolkata, West Bengal, India, also referred to as the Imperial Museum at Calcutta in colonial-era texts, is the ninth oldest museum of the world, oldest museum in India and the largest museum in India. 27, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata 700016 ₹100 033 2252 1790 Tue-Sun : 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM Indian Coffee House It has been for a long time a regular hang out and a renowned meeting place (adda) for intellectuals and students (and ex-students) of the Presidency College, University of Calcutta, and other institutions in College Street. It has played an important part in Calcutta's (Kolkata) cultural history and known as the hub of intellectual debates. Sharda Book Stall, No.15 Near, Bankim Chatterjee St, College Square, Kolkata, West Bengal 700073 ₹14~₹110 090077 98519 Mon-Sun : 9:00 AM - 09:00 PM Botanical Gardens The Botanical Gardens are a haven amidst the chaos of Kolkata. Lush and rich with flora, all your eyes can see are shades of green that soothe and relax a tired mind. 1, 2-8-1 Nishi-Shinjuku, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo +91 3326685357 ₹100 Mon-Sun : 08:30 AM - 05:00 PM
Oudh 1590 Traditional Awadhi dishes & cauldron-cooked curries served amid 16th-century period decor. Shop P 562, Hemanata Mukhopadhyay Sarani, Southern Avenue, Kolkata +918961556551 Mon-Sun : 12noon – 3:30pm, 6:30pm – 10:30pm Arsalan Spacious restaurant & catering service for a Mughlai menu & a range of specialty biryanis.. 191, Park Street, Near 7 Point Crossing, Park Circus Area, Kolkata +91 3322844019 Mon-Sun : 10:30am – 12:45am Flurys Open since 1927, this stylish tearoom serves Indian & European cakes/pastries, plus light fare. 18, Park street Area, Kolkata +91 3340007452 Mon-Sun : 7:30am – 11pm Oh! Calcutta Stylish chain dining room for a menu specialising in the unique cooking of Calcutta. 10/3 Elgin Road 4th Floor, Forum Mall, Kolkata 700016 India +91 33 2283 7161 Mon-Sat : 12:30 AM - 3:30 PM ; 7:00 PM - 11:00 PM Haldiram's Prabhuji Indian dishes and a range of special namkeens from a simple chain outlet. P420, Kazi Nazrul Islam Avenue, V.I.P. Road, Kaikhali, Kolkata +91 3340144444 Mon-Sun : 9am – 8:45pm Balaram Mullick & Radharam Mullick Sweets Enduring counter-serve specializing in traditional Indian sweets & baked goods since 1885. 2, Paddapukur Road, Jadubabur Bazar, Bhowanipore, Kolkata 700020 +91 3324222211 Mon-Sun : 10am – 10pm Mainland China Chinese Flavors That Truly Have a 'Different' Tantalizing Effect on Taste Buds. 3A, Uniworth House, Gurusaday Road, Ballygunge, Kolkata +91 6292192008 Mon : 12:45pm – 3:30pm, 7pm – 11pm; Sat-Sun : 12:30pm – 3:30pm, 7pm – 11:30pm
//Hotels Category Strings Hyatt Regency Hyatt Regency Kolkata is a luxury business hotel in Kolkata (or “Calcutta”), India. The hotel creates the feel of a private cocoon away from the complexities of modern living without giving up any of its luxuries. Hyatt Regency Kolkata is located next to Salt Lake Stadium & 15 mins drive from IT hub and is a preferred business destination of East India. JA - 1 Sector III Salt Lake City, Kolkata 700098 +91 33 6820 1234 The Westin We are conveniently located in New Town Kolkata, 8 Kms from the Airport. Our 304 well-appointed rooms and suites are one of the largest in the city offering inspiring views of the cityscape. We offer a variety of dining options including 3132, the highest rooftop bar in the city and the award winning Seasonal Tastes. Plot No. CBD/2, Action Area - II, New Town, Rajarhat, Kolkata 585316 033 4037 1234 JW Marriott JW Marriott Hotel Kolkata is located about one kilometre from Science City museum in Kolkata. This modern hotel offers high-tech rooms and world-class amenities including a vast infinity pool and a luxurious spa. 4 A,J.B.S Haldane Avenue, 700105, Kolkata 033 6633 0000 Monotel - Luxury Business Hotel Monotel is a Luxury Business Hotel, Located in the IT Hub of Kolkata. Being an Eco friendly hotel, Monotel is an environmentally conscious hotel that has heralded a new standard of environmental responsibility in the hospitality industry. Sector - V Dm 2 Salt Lake, Kolkata 700091 033 4030 2000 The Pride Hotel Experience the rich cultural tapestry of Calcutta garnished with the modern charm of our 5-star hotel in Kolkata. Pride Plaza Hotel is enclosed within the business hubs of Kolkata city, offering luxury accommodation for corporates and leisure travellers alike. New Town Terminus, B.G-12, Action Area I, 1-B, Newtown, Kolkata 700156 033 4025 9999 The Oberoi Grand Located in Kolkata’s main shopping district, the New Market and business district, The Oberoi Grand Kolkata houses an outdoor pool, gym and spa. 15 Jawaharlal Nehru Road, Kolkata 560001 033 2249 2323 ITC Royal Bengal Situated in Kolkata, 7 km from Indian Museum, ITC Royal Bengal, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Kolkata features accommodation with a restaurant, free private parking, a fitness centre and a bar. Featuring a garden, the property is located within 7 km of Nandan. The accommodation offers a 24-hour front desk, room service and currency exchange for guests. 1 JBS Haldane Avenue, Kolkata 700046 033 4446 4646 Taj Bengal Set in landscaped grounds in downtown Kolkata, Taj Bengal offers 5-star luxury with elegant rooms, an outdoor pool and spa. It features a 24-hour gym, free parking and 6 restaurants. 34B, Belvedere Road, Alipore, Kolkata 700027 033 6612 3939
About the 𝙏𝙃𝙀 𝘾𝙄𝙏𝙔 𝙊𝙁 𝙅𝙊𝙔 The second biggest city of the country, Kolkata was formerly called as 𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗰𝘂𝘁𝘁𝗮. Being the 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗕𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗵 𝗥𝗮𝗷, Kolkata is a city that holds an extremely crucial place in the economy, politics and culture of India. Being the 𝗖𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗪𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗕𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗮𝗹, Kolkata is also known as the 𝗰𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮. With a quintessential charm that it has retained apart from just the modernization, Kolkata is amongst the four metropolitan cities of India. With a dense heritage, Kolkata is densely populated and is situated at the banks of river Ganga. Being famous for its culture, Kolkata is known for its people, food, music, literature and movies as well. Being the home of few major and great thinkers, artists, film makes and writers, Kolkata is associated with 𝗥𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗵 𝗧𝗮𝗴𝗼𝗿𝗲, 𝗕𝗮𝗻𝗸𝗶𝗺 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗼𝗽𝗮𝗱𝗵𝗮𝘆𝗮𝘆, 𝗦𝗮𝗿𝗮𝘁 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗼𝗽𝗮𝗱𝗵𝗮𝘆𝗮𝘆 and 𝗦𝙖𝘁𝗮𝘆𝗷𝗶𝘁 𝗥𝗼𝘆. No wonder, Kolkata is indeed an inspiration for the country in the field of art literature and theater. Considered as if Bangalore is the Seattle of India then Kolkata is the sub continent\’s London. The \‘in your face\’ city that leaves every single visitor in shock with its charm, abject poverty inexplicably with crumbling the gems of British Raj era, sprawling gardens and historical colleges. Kolkata is a city one can hate or love but will never forget in his lifetime. Helpful Tips! >> 𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙤 𝙂𝙚𝙩 𝘼𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙙? The bright yellow \‘Ambassador Classics\’ with comfy bucket seats are one of the things you\’ll first notice when you travel to Kolkata. Also you can take the metro/subway. 
 

>>𝙍𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙖 𝙋𝙤𝙘𝙠𝙚𝙩 𝙒𝙞𝙛𝙞 𝘿𝙚𝙫𝙞𝙘𝙚 Having a strong and uninterrupted wifi connection is a must when traveling, especially when you’re in a city as chaotic as Kolkata. Being able to navigate with Google Maps alone makes it worthwhile. One option is 𝘗𝘰𝘬𝘦𝘧𝘪 which is a global wifi device, but if you need to rent one in India, then you can do so through 𝘒𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘬. 
 

>> 𝙒𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙚? Here's a list of Things to do, Places to visit & foods to try: 
 
 > 𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘴: 
 - Get fascinated by the statues of deities in potter’s colony of Kolkata (𝙆𝙪𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙤𝙡𝙞). 
 - Explore Mallick Ghat Flower Market. 
 - Visit Eden Garden – Take A Plunge Into History 
 - 𝙏𝙧𝙖𝙢𝙨 We all know that Kolkata is the only Indian state to serve the busy bees with the Tram service beside other modes of travel. But do you know that it has been operating since the year 1902! The Calcutta Tramways Company today runs the oldest electric trams in Asia. - Take a boat ride in 𝘗𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘱 𝘎𝘩𝘢𝘵 during dawn and 𝘞𝘢𝘵𝘤𝘩 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘶𝘯 𝘎𝘰 𝘋𝘰𝘸𝘯. 
 

> 𝘗𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦𝘴: 
 - New Market 
 - Visit kolkata during 𝘿𝙪𝙧𝙜𝙖 𝙋𝙪𝙟𝙖 (One of my favourite festivals of India :D). 
 - Visit 𝘋𝘢𝘬𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘩𝘸𝘢𝘳 and 𝘒𝘢𝘭𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘢𝘵 temple. 
 - Visit the Colonial Structures such as 𝘚𝘵. 𝘗𝘢𝘶𝘭\’𝘴 𝘊𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘥𝘳𝘢𝘭, 𝘔𝘢𝘳𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘗𝘢𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦, 𝘒𝘰𝘭𝘬𝘢𝘵𝘢 𝘛𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘏𝘢𝘭𝘭, 𝘊𝘢𝘭𝘤𝘶𝘵𝘵𝘢 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘊𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘉𝘦𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘌𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦. - Day Trip to 𝘚𝘶𝘯𝘥𝘢𝘳𝘣𝘢𝘯𝘴. 
 

> Foods: 
 - Want something for breakfast? try 𝘒𝘰𝘤𝘩𝘶𝘳𝘪 and 𝘢𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘳 𝘥𝘶𝘮. 
 - Craving for an snack already? try 𝙋𝙝𝙪𝙘𝙝𝙠𝙖. 
 - Try 𝘐𝘭𝘪𝘴𝘩 𝘮𝘢𝘢𝘤𝘩 or other fish recipes for lunch options & end the meal with 𝙈𝙞𝙨𝙝𝙩𝙞 𝘿𝙤𝙞. 
 - Spend a pleasant evening at the ghats of river Ganga munching on 𝘛𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘣𝘩𝘢𝘫𝘢 and 𝘑𝘩𝘢𝘭 𝘔𝘶𝘳𝘪 while enjoying the sunset. 
 Or, Have a 𝘒𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘪 𝘙𝘰𝘭𝘭 at 𝘕𝘪𝘻𝘢𝘮'𝘴 - End the day on a sweet note with 𝙍𝙤𝙨𝙝𝙤𝙜𝙤𝙡𝙡𝙖 or chanar 𝙎𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙨𝙝.
